thread.title: NYC judge flooded with suits to fight Trump’s immigration order
thread.title_full: NYC judge flooded with suits to fight Trump’s immigration order

author: Andrew Keshner
title: NYC judge flooded with suits to fight Trump’s immigration order
text:
Brooklyn judge flooded with federal lawsuits to fight President Trump’s executive order, free detained immigrants NYC judge flooded with suits to fight Trump’s immigration order Judge Carol Bagley Amon is the Brooklyn federal judge assigned to lawsuits against President Trump's immigration order. (Mary Altaffer/AP)  54 PM 
The flurry of Brooklyn federal lawsuits filed to free detained immigrants and fight President Trump's executive order have been assigned to one judge. 
Brooklyn Federal Judge Carol Bagley Amon was assigned the cases Monday, including the petition that resulted in another judge issuing a Saturday evening emergency stay to block removals. 
Judge Ann Donnelly was the miscellaneous duty judge when that case was first filed. 
The jobs of judges on miscellaneous duty include immediate rulings when something urgent comes up after hours. 
Though Amon got the Darweesh case and then 16 cases deemed to be related under federal court rules, a number have been voluntarily dismissed. Amon is also fighting to block President Trump's order and to keep detained immigrants in the U.S. (ANDREW HARRER / POOL/EPA) 
The Darweesh case is ongoing and the sides will put in papers on the matter through next month. 
Amon, a longtime federal prosecutor, was nominated for the bench by President George H. W. Bush in 1990. 
She served as the Brooklyn U.S. Attorney’s chief judge from 2011 to 2016. Join the Conversation:
